str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From paraballo; a similitude, i.e. fictitious narrative, apothegm or adage.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A fig-tree. From sukon; a fig-tree.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A young tender shoot, then: a branch; met: of descendants. From klao; a twig or bough.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Soft, tender, as a shoot of a tree. Of uncertain derivation; soft.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put forth, cause to sprout. From ek and phuo; to sprout up.
A leaf. From the same as phule; a sprout, i.e. Leaf.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Summer. From a primary thero; properly, heat, i.e. Summer.
Near. From a primary verb agcho; near.
